chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter J. Raupp was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Peter J. Raupp was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges (except first 48 hours).  Jail to commence Forthwith.

Provide DNA sample if not provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to operate m/v w/o valid DL and consent of agent.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol.  Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant has 65 days credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: from State Public Defender's Office

Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant Peter J. Raupp in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  State notes corrections per Atty Gumz to the PSI.  Court also notes letter of 10/7/2014.  Atty Gumz states no one will speak on behalf of his client today, although his parents are present.  Atty Gumz acknowledges rec. PSI w/no factual changes besides what was already mentioned.  State states recs.  Atty Gumz responds.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of voting rights, felony firearm warnings and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  
3 years probation
Conditions of probation:
6 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence (1st 48 hrs waived) to commence FORTHWITH
Fine/costs/surcharges of $1744.00 to be paid during probation per agent
Revocation of DL for 36 months
IID for 36 months effective upon licensure
AODA
Absolute sobriety at all times
DNA sample to be provided
Not to go to any bars/taverns/liquor stores
Counseling per agent
Not to operate any MV w/o valid DL, IID and agent's permission
65 jail credit only if probation is revoked

Ct 3:
Costs/surcharges of $443.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

14TR956 and 14TR957 are dismissed
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 6, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Plea to Count 1 & 3.  Dismiss Count 2.  State requesting PSI.  Count 3 undecided.    Plea to Count 3 as well.  State gives prior conviction.  Court goes through guilty plea with defendant.  Stipulates to prior offenses.  Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI ordered and to be completed no later than Sept 29, 2014.  To be set for sentencing with Br. 3.  Report to Sauk County Jail by 6 p.m., August 3, 2014.
Plea hearing on August 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard states DE is ready to plea today but there will be a PSI.  Requests reset to next Monday.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Woodard acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.  14TR956 and 14TR957 to track.

Defendant Peter J. Raupp in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard waives prelim and requests arraignment and JT be set.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.
